description: Part five, part three  storey upper floor extension (making a total height of 7 storey at the rear) incorporating 9 residential units (6x 1bed, 2 x 1 bed with studio area and 1 x 2bed) with outdoor amenity space at first floor level.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers SK- 05 rev. 2, SK- 06 rev. 2, SK- 07 and SK- 14 (received 27/01/2014) and SK- 31 rev. 16, SK- 34 rev. 3 and SK- 35 rev. 5 (received 24/07/2014)  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials and finishes to be used for the external surfaces of the development hereby approved (including windows) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials and finishes harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 (h), 1.2(g), & 2.1 (c) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 4C, 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4, 7.6 & 7.8 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No occupation of the buildings hereby approved shall take place until full details hard/soft landscape works has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be completed as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with a programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the residential amenity, in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), 2.1(c) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval before the development is commenced, for the insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, which will achieve the Local Planning Authority's internal criteria for sensitive rooms. The details should also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation in accordance with Authority's criteria. The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: In the interest of the neighbouring residential development, in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2011, policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Notwithstanding any information a detailed site construction method statement and management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development.  The method statement/management plan shall include but not limited to the following:  i). Construction worker parking ii). Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles. iii). Delivery times iv). Dust suppression measures v). Site security vi). Vehicle manoeuvring and turning vii). Locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices viii). Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents, ix) measures to ensure the construction process does not affect of neighbouring highways, and x). details of whell water spraying facilitites. Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  REASON:  To protect the amenity of neighbouriong occupiers, to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.13 and 7.14 of the London Plan (2011), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, the residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to achieve to a minimum Level 4 of the Code for Sustainable Homes (based on November 2010 Technical Guide). The associated reports/ assessment and certifications to demonstrate compliance shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval at three different stages:  "	Prior of commencement of development. Evidence of registration of the development with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the Code for Sustainable Homes and an Interim Code for Sustainable Homes Assessment and Certificates.  "	After completion of Development and prior to first occupation.  A Post-Construction Code for Sustainable Homes Review/Report.  "	6 months after the date of first occupation of the development Post-Construction Stage Certificates verified by the BRE, confirming that the agreed sustainability measures have been implemented.  REASON:  To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2 and  5.3 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1 (k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy 5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | The ground floor refuse storage area hereby approved at the rear shall only be used for that purpose and be fully provided prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living/working conditions of occupiers neighbouring properties and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2011) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the cycle parking information provided with this application, only 9 wall mounted lockable bike racks shall be provided in the flank elevation of the side return of the existing building, the cycle parking provision shall be fully installed and made available prior to the first use of the development hereby approved and retained thereafter.   REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for cycle parking within the site in accordance with policy 1.1 (f) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.9 & 6.13 of The London Plan (2012), and The National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, a wheelchair lift shall be installed to the rear staircase providing access between ground floor - first floor level courtyard and full details of all wheelchair lifts approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  REASON: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.2 of The London Plan (2011),  and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The four windows in the east facing elevation of the development hereby approved shall be fitted with obscured glazing and retained as such thereafter.   Reason: In the interest of prospective occupiers of the residential development hereby approved, in accordance with policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
